text:
Hello and welcome to Cupcake Addiction's Tow
Mater Cupcake Tutorial where I'll be showing

you how to make this really cool little Tow
Mater cupcake out of the movie Cars.

Today's tutorial is part of a collaboration
that I'm doing with Ann over at How to Cook
That.

She's made for you guys this amazing lightning
McQueen 3-dimensional sculpted cake.
Make sure that you check out Ann's channel.

Her channel is called How to Cook That so
make sure you check her out.

Tools and equipment that we will be using
today:
I've got my Tow Mater printable cupcake wrapper.

I will leave a link to this in the description
box below.

And I've also note that I've actually lined
mine with just a little bit of wax or greaseproof
paper.

Whenever you're using cupcake liners or cupcake
wrappers, the frosting has the tendency to

just seep a little bit through the cardboard
liner or the cardboard case so I like to line

mine now just with a little bit of that wax
paper.

And just make sure that it don't get any seeping
of any of the oils from your frosting into
that cupcake wrapper.

I will also mention today that I've printed
those out on a 210 gsm card, so a little bit
thicker than a regular paper stack.

And I just like to print it out on that card
but it makes them a little bit sturdier.
I've got some sticky tape.
I've got my cupcake ready to ice.
I'm using some chocolate ganache today.

Now I do have a tutorial on my channel for
dark chocolate ganache.

I've made that exact recipe but using milk
chocolate because I want it to be a little
bit lighter color for our Tow Mater.

And it is basically a 50-50 mixture of milk
chocolate and cream which we microwaved.

Once it starts to set, I've given it a very
very small whip.
It's going to be completely cool.

Once it starts to set, give it a small whip
with your beaters and it will come up to that
lovely, fluffy consistency.

Otherwise, you can just use any chocolate
frosting.
I've got a knife.
I've got some of these little white sprinkles.

These ones are called nonpareils and they're
just a tiny, little, white sprinkles.

Some crashed up cookie crumbs, crashed up
Oreos.
A little bit of dark chocolate.

I've got a couple of white chocolate melts
or white candy melts.
I've got a couple of these little white candies.
So these are just your little...
I think in the U.S. they're called Smarties.

But you can see, they're just part of a little
candy roll and I've just picked out some of
the white ones.
A couple of chocolate bullets.

I've got one whole one and one that I've cut
in half.
And I've got some mini Oreos.

Now I've already cut those in half and taken
the Oreo stuff or the Oreo filling out of
them.

I've got some chocolate wafer fingers but
you can also use Kitkats for this tutorial.
And I've got a skewer.
So let's get started.

The first thing that we're going to do is
we're going to take our cupcake and wrap in
our cupcake wrapper.
So you want to take your wrapper.
And I always do this.

These are pretty much a one-size-fits-all
wrapper.
So take your cupcake and fold it around.

You'll notice it overlaps a little bit at
the back.
That's great.
You can cut it off if you like.
You don't have to.
These ones are really a one-size-fits-all.

So for you guys at home, just cut it off so
that you've got the exact size that you're
looking for to suit your cupcakes.

But I know that we all bake in slightly different
size and shape cupcake liners and cupcake
[dint].

So just taking your sticky tape, just place
a little bit of sticky tape at the back there

and you've got your wrapped cupcake ready
to go.
So now you want to take that chocolate ganache.

Now I'm using chocolate ganache because it's
a bit firmer than a regular frosting.
So it actually sets a little firmer.

It's a little bit easier to handle and it's
not as sweet.
It's a bit richer but it's not as sweet.

There's going to be a fair bit of frosting
on this cupcake.
I just prefer ganache.

So I'm just going to scoop that ganache with
my knife and I'm just going to scoop it on

top of our cupcake to a nice, sort of a high
mound there.

And do be careful that you've got...You're
not working with dirty hands here.

So if you do get frosting or anything on your
hands, make sure that you do go and clean

it off because you don't want to be putting
any of the oils from that frosting into your
cupcake wrapper.

So I'm just going to use my knife and I'm
just going to work that frosting back and
forward.

And I actually want to meet that frosting
up with that cardboard liner.

Alright, so you've got there just a nice,
rounded mound of your chocolate ganache.

So what you want to do is you want to find
your front, so where Tow Mater's nose is.
And I'm just going to scrape backwards.

So scrape backwards and make like a bit of
a flat front there.

And that's also going to give us our positioning
for our eyes.

Make sure that you can't see any of your cupcake
showing through.

You should have something that looks a little
bit like this.

So now we want to take our eyes and just sit
them in.

So I've picked 2 of the largest candy melts
that I could find.

So in your packet, you're going to have slightly
different shapes and sizes.

Go for the largest ones that you can get your
hands on.

And you want to face that cupcake towards

And we're going to pop in 1 candy melt and

So you do want those positioned sort of a

guess, across the cupcake because we want
the little Oreo tire and the lights and all

So now you want to take a little bit more
of this ganache.

And we're just going to build up that front
a little bit and give us that flat line across
the eyes there.

So you can see why I've scraped so much off
because we sort of want to put his eyes in

and then have a bit of room to fill that up
again.

So as I'm doing this, I'm just going to use

up so that I'm getting that really nice, flat
line across the bottom of the eyes.

Really they are, the Cars guys, their eyes
are not round.
They're square.

So we're using a round candy melts but we

Now you want to just make sure that you've
built that front up a little bit so that it's
almost a bit square-ish at the front.

And I'm just going to scrape around so I've
got a nice, neat finish, and even off again.
Beautiful.

Now you can leave the front looking like that
at the moment.

With the back, you want to just scrape that

eyes.

Don't worry that it's pushing eyes a little

That's totally fine.

We just want to scrape it up because this

And then push those eyes back so that they

Taking a bit more ganache or frosting, whatever

So you really want the frosting or the ganache

And repositioning those eyes so they're just

But bear in mind you do want them to be quite

Now you want to take your knife with a bit

And we're just going to build in, I guess,
the sort of the sleepy looking eyes or the

So one side is going to be quite a bit bigger

So you can see there I'm just using the back

And then for the other side, just slightly

So you do want to have one that's distinctively,

With Tow Mater, he doesn't need to be too

And then you can take this ganache and the

Just grabby him up a little bit.

Now to make the little, his, I guess, his
